one of the best story game out there. love it.

Jeuxvideos l'avait noté à 19/20 et franchement je me demande comment c'est possible.

Si je pouvais mettre un pouce entre-deux je le ferai, car ce jeu a aussi pleins de qualités. Mais à voir plus de 90% de commentaires positifs et des notes sur certains sites le montrant comme une perle du 21ème siècle, j'ai tout de même de la peine...

Faut compter 10-15 heures pour boucler l'histoire. Les combats sont assez dynamiques avec des armes assez variées et à cela on ajoute encore des pouvoirs différents, mais aussi assez répétitif. L'IA est pas extraordinaire, mais ce n'est pas ça qui m'a gêné le plus. A cour de munitions? ça vous arrivera et vous devrez passer à une autre arme pour continuer de combattre. Alors j'ai vu certaines critiques là-dessus, mais en toute honnêteté je trouvais cela presque bien, car cela forçait de changer d'arme et sa façon de jouer. Les graphismes sont bons et l'univers original. La présence d'Elisabeth est agréable.

Et le négatif? Pour moi c'est l'histoire ou plutôt la fin. Pour moi on nous balance dans un bordel temporel/monde parallèle truffé d'incohérences et avec une multitudes de questions en suspens. J'ai pas de soucis de partir dans ces histoires de monde parallèle ou temporel, mais là pendant 8h on vous donne au goûte à goûte et à la fin on balance tout. Seulement que je trouve qu'il y a peins de choses incohérentes ou pas clair et au final ce qui aurait pu être un jeu assez sympa devient un jeu lambda.

Si je devais le noter je lui donnerai 14-15 sur 20. Donc c'est pas un mauvais jeu, mais il est clairement sur-vendu.

I didn't quite like the ending, but still a good game. 8/10

非常值得玩的一款FPS游戏。枪械种类多 技能也有许多花样，玩起来手感很不错，再加上有比较好的指路系统 还是可以有不错的射击体验的（不过子弹确实少，还有收集要素过多，有强迫症的话可能会有点麻烦）
整体画风偏卡通，但是实际上血腥暴力程度不低，剧情也有些黑暗（虽然我没怎么看懂，但是剧情确实挺不错的）
流程大概就是9~12小时左右吧，后面还有各种挑战模式 和各类收藏品可以解锁 可玩性很高
女主角色塑造的不错 而且经常给钱 打架的时候给补给，还是无敌（这不比一堆zz的花瓶女主强多了（

바이오쇼크를 인피니티로 접했고 이 게임에 반해 거꾸로 바쇽1로 넘어갔는데, 확실히 밝은 아트워크가 가져오는 강점이 크게 느껴진다. 압도적으로 아름다운 도시에서 벌어지는 스토리 진행에 몰입하다보면 너무나 강렬한 엔딩을 만나게 된다. 엔딩이 나는 조금 어렵긴 했는데 다른 유저분들의 후기를 보며 이런 저런 생각을 해보는 것도 또 하나의 재미였다.

Pretty old game at this point so if you're incabable of playing games with obvious polygons on some models then just leave now. BUT.... The game is very fun, great FPS combat system, a good variety of guns, rewarding scavenging with lots of looting to do, and an alright story.

Es cierto que hasta cierto punto el juego es bueno. pero lo que mas odio es que esto es tan opuesto a bioshock, que ya no es bioshock.
La jugabilidad, el desarrollo, entre otras cosas, son muy malas comparadas con los anteriores. Mientras en los otros juegos, al no tener historia el personaje, podias sentirte identificado o que tus acciones repercutian en algo. En este juego no, no importa lo que hagas, casi ni cambia
La unica recomendacion es que si te gustan los FPS freneticos, este es tu juego.
Si no es el caso, lo lamento ya no hay "otro" bioshock. Lo unico mas cerca es lo del panteon marino. pero es solo lo mismo aun que abajo del agua. Ni se esforsaron en cambiar la mayoria de modelos.
Simplemente. Una decepccion

Una obra de arte

Одна из тех игр, о которых хочется кричать на каждом углу.

Сюжет отличный, концовка захватывает дух. Само погружение в историю реализовано просто великолепно. Как все закручивается, как раскрывается Букер. Это нечто.

Окружение и атмосфера выше всяких похвал. Персонажам веришь.
Ох, Элизабет, душа моя, как же я по тебе скучаю. 

Пожалуй в игре разочаровывает только стрельба. Все-таки реализация прицела на отдельную кнопку клавиатуры — как-то дико. Да и само оружие ощущается плохо. С большим удовольствием я пользовалась добиваниями и скиллами.

Я проходила игру два раза (один до того, как начала активно заносить Габену) и после. И планирую рано или поздно пройти еще раз. И длс зацепить.

Игра вызывает бурю эмоций при прохождении и некоторое опустошение после. Она играет на нервах (вот тут я уже не уверена, про игру я или про Элизабет) и заставляет подумать над своей историей. 
Это отличное произведение.

I am conflicted about this one.
I would give it an Average score but we can't do that here on Steam...

I respect their choice to move the story in this direction, give us a city in the sky was great and all..but.
But Bioshock that I know was about an underwater city in the horror and shooter genre.
With Infinite, the chance for a Bioshock 3 or 4 coming out that would play in Rapture again is very VERY slim.
I loved Rapture.

Now look at this, it has been 8 years and there was no new game.
I am planning on replaying Bioshock 1 and 2 again, again. But I do not feel the desire to play Infinite again... :(

So the game is not bad, I still recommend to try it out. But I myself am on the fence here...

This game is pretty bad. Like, pretty stinkin' bad. I played it all in one sitting, the DLC over the next two days or so, and it ended up probably becoming the worst 9-12 hours I've ever spent playing a game. Those 3 extra hours (I think) were mostly from pause breaks and having to replay sections due to the fact that there are no manual saves and only checkpoints.

Now, I'd [i]love[/i] to write an excessively long, detailed essay about how much I dislike this game. I'd [i]love[/i] to go into every single little nitpick I had with this game. I'd [i]love[/i] to list every pro (which are few in number), con, and "meh" of this game, but I'm not going to.
Unfortunately, I'd probably exceed the character limit and bore everyone who reads this thing to death because of its length. So, to the best of my ability, I'll just keep things as brief as humanly possible and only point out the major stuff. Yeah, this review's still gonna be a [i]little bit[/i] long, but it won't put you to sleep as quickly as it would if I really doubled down.

If you have played Bioshock 1 & 2 (or even its spiritual predecessor, System Shock) and [i]liked[/i] those games, then this game is a severely painful slap in the face. If you have not played those games, then this would be incredibly mediocre at best and an extremely boring slog at worst. Heck, you might hate it regardless.
The gameplay is incredibly dumbed down from its predecessors. Combat is excessively easy and requires little to no strategy or skill. You can only carry two guns at one time, which isn't much in terms of "balance" because nearly more than half of the guns are useless. A designated melee weapon slot has been removed and replaced with a designated melee attack key (and your melee attack cannot be upgraded, so it does the same amount of damage unless you equip gear that affects melee). Weapon and Vigor upgrades are too easily accessible, can be purchased at almost any time, and by extension don't really allow for individual builds and unique styles of gameplay since it [i]is possible[/i] to buy every upgrade in the game. Additionally, weapon and Vigor upgrades are really expensive, so even when you find enough money to buy one $1,000 upgrade for something, you're probably not going to be able to buy another one for a while unless you horde money like a crazy person. That, or you forget to buy anything at all and check to see that you have a couple hundred thousand dollars sitting around in your pockets, which is kinda what happened to me on occasion.
All-in-1 Health/Salt/"Shield" stat upgrades replace health and EVE upgrades, and you can only pick one at a time when found as opposed to purchasing with ADAM. And oh yeah, all upgrades (aside from base stats) use the same currency so there's no secondary currency you need to be saving up for special attributes and abilities, which makes progression a tad less complex.
Most of the Vigors are useless and all practically have the exact same function (save for a handful, and by that I mean like 2 or 3 of them), that being to stun enemies. All Vigors have a trap function, instead of said trap functions being an optional upgrade, or having a designated "trap Vigor". Overall, Vigors have no variety and are for the most part useless. No matter what Vigor you use, it will do the same thing as all the others. It's really just a matter of which Vigor you think looks the coolest, which one stuns enemies the longest, and which one does the most damage.
The game's linear nature in terms of level design is one thing that people like to complain about, which I honestly don't care for [i]as much[/i] as other people, but it is a problem I guess. Exploration is practically nowhere to be seen, which I understand is definitely a bummer. And yeah, the battle arenas are pretty stupid and they get really annoying if there's one every five seconds. The fact that enemies become bullet sponges at about the halfway point or so doesn't help with this either. The criticism of this game having way too many combat arenas is honestly well-deserved. Instead of small, brief encounters that last only a few seconds, we get annoying, drawn out fights in intentionally open areas. Bioshock 2 had that issue on rare occasions, but if you were at all strategic and competent about combat the arenas weren't that much of a drag and fights didn't have to last longer than a few minutes. This game however, with its stupidly simple combat, removes any and all necessity to be calculated and efficient in how you fight a big wave of enemies. 
Elizabeth is your AI partner, and she basically becomes a crutch if the game feels like it isn't already holding your hand enough. She gives you Ammo, Salts, Health, Money, and her tear ability gives you a huge advantage over nearly every obstacle that comes your way. No more health kits, no more EVE Hypos, no more alternative ammo types, no more resource management, no more Gene Tonics, just an endless supply of salts and health from your trusty partner. What a joy, what a treat.
The story's really shit. Even if you ignore this game's title, the story is abysmal, confusing, and pretentious. It tries to be deep and intriguing, but it ends up being more of a nonsensical mess of out-of-place sociopolitical issues. Issues that, normally would be fine if presented in a decent and sensitive way, are instead barely explored beyond "racism bad" and "extremist ideologies bad". In other words, this game tries to be edgy without justifying its edginess. Perhaps this game's controversial themes were simply pandering to the storytelling methods of its contemporaries at the time.
Also, this game for some reason throws in weird sci-fi fantasy pseudo-quantum physics malarkey that totally throws everything off the rails and completely severs itself from the rest of the series. The character of Elizabeth drives nearly the whole plot, and that, to me, puts her dangerously close towards Mary Sue territory. Think what you want about Elizabeth's character design, but she, as a character, is really boring and uninteresting. All the other characters are pretty boring too. No depth, no true development, no nothing. There was also some other deep stuff they threw in, but it too horrendously failed to peak my interest or intrigue at all.
People like to complain about the plot twist at the end the most, which I myself didn't complain about, mostly because the rest of the story confused and bewildered me so much that by the time I reached the end my brain was just absolutely numb and unable to comprehend what I was witnessing at all. [spoiler]However, the tie-in to the first game really pissed me off, as it looked like the devs just went "Hey look, it's Rapture! Remember Rapture?"[/spoiler]
Burial at Sea, the game's DLC, was a step in not exactly the [i]right[/i] direction, but the more [i]serviceable[/i] direction. Going back to Rapture was nice, and seeing a pre-Bioshock 1 Rapture was kinda cool in the beginning. The art direction changed a lot, though, and some of it seemed a bit jarring to me. But hey, gotta update the art direction for a new era, I guess? Ep. 1 REALLY wanted to bring back resource management to the point of obsession. Ep. 2 was interesting, turning into a stealth game which I haven't ever seen in the series. It was a bit frustrating, though, both Episodes. The story was still kinda crap, though. [spoiler]The tie-in with Bioshock 1 is that Elizabeth, apparently, was the one responsible for giving Fontaine control of Jack. Therefore, Elizabeth is the reason why most of the events of Bioshock even occur. When I saw that, I felt no regret in [i]firmly placing Elizabeth in the Mary Sue Club.[/i] What a load of bullcrap. Burial at Sea was overall ok, but I will [b]never[/b] forgive it for trying to cram itself into the series' timeline that forcefully, especially with fucking Elizabeth at the helm.[/spoiler]

Bioshock Infinitela entrega más reciente de esta franquicia, para mi el juego base se siente algo crudo al compararlo con sus antecesores, principalmente no me gustó no poder guardar la partida a voluntad, lo cual fue algo molesto al principio, pero por otro lado al menos el juego no crashea, como los remastered del 1 y el 2. Por eso, a pesar de todos sus problemas, lo recomiendo altamente.

Şİmdi gelelim Bioshock serisinin son oyununa. İlk iki oyunu oynamış biri olarak size görüşlerimi aktaracağım. 
Öncelikle oyunun artılarından başlayalım;

+Vuruş hissiyatı ilk iki oyuna göre aşırı iyi olmuş.

+Oyunda karakterlerin seslendirmesi oldukça iyi. Ana karakter konuşabiliyor ve bu karaktere daha aşina olmanızı sağlıyor.

+İlk iki oyun gibi bu oyunda da hikaye güzel. Oyun sizi içine çekiyor. Merak duygunuzu açığa çıkarıyor.

+Elizabeth karakteri oyunun çoğu kısmında yanımızda olması ve gerçekten de bize çok yardımı dokunuyor. Yani resmen arkadaşınızla oynuyormuşsunuz hissi uyandırıyor. Sürekli mermi ve para topluyor resmen sizin için.

Bir yanda da eksileri var. Onlar da şöyle;

-Mermi sıkıntısı yok. Dolu dolu mermimiz var ve ilk iki oyundaki zorluk ortadan kalkmış durumda. Zaten Elizabeth bize mermi desteği de sağladığı için mermi konusunda sıkıntımız yok. Bu oyunu kolaylaştırmış durumda.

-Oyunda sağlam bir boss savaşı yok. İlk iki oyunda canavarlara karşı zorlanıyorduk. Ya mermi sıkıntımız oluyordu ya da can sıkıntımız. Sürekli otomatlarda para harcıyorduk. Burada otomatlar var ama harcamak için nedeniniz yok. Her şeyi dışarıdan bulmak kolay.

-Bir de mesela bazı silahlar kafaya tek atıyor. Aiminiz iyiyse herkesin kafasına tek atıp ilerlemek çok kolay. Bu oyunda ölmek  çok zor. İlk 2 oyunda böyle değildi. İlk iki oyundan sağlam çıktıysanız bu oyun sizin için çocuk oyuncağı.Bir kere bile ölmez mi insan yahu!!! Ben ölmedim ve bunun için özel çaba sarf etmedim. 

-İlk iki oyunun o karanlık atmosferi ve o yalnızlık hissi bu oyunda yok. Bu oyunda atmosfer çok tatlı mı tatlı olmuş. O korkutucu atmosfer bioshock evreninin ayrılmaz  bir ikilisiydi.

Genel olarak oyun oynarken eğlendim ve hikayesi gerçekten güzel. Ama bu oyunda sağlam bir boss savaşı isterdim ve ellerinde gerçekten de karşımıza çıkaracak sağlam ve çok güçlü bir seçenek vardı ama onunla savaşmıyoruz. Resmen oyunda karşımıza sıradan askerler çıkıyor ve yapmamız gereken onları öldürmek. Tıpkı Call Of Duty tarzı. Ama bu oyun  Bioshock kardeşim.

Subtracts too many gameplay elements from the previous titles without providing meaningful replacement. The story is a shallow and underdeveloped argument against racism and offers no insights into it being a part of society other than, "it's just a product of the times, y'know man?" Linearity in game design is never a bad thing, but when the first title in the series is one of the most immersive experiences in gaming history that makes you forget you're in a fictional setting at times, I become disappointed when I don't see the same effort and love put into the followup. Columbia is nothing more than a surface-level set-piece for you to parade through, guns blazing, maybe once or twice. There's very little reason to come back to this game as the same love given to the prior entries (yes, that even means 2) is absent in place of meeting a deadline. I don't claim I know what happened behind the scenes in this game, but man for a game with three rewrites you'd think they would've thought things through a little more. It just fails as a followup to Bioshock 1 and 2 in an unfathomable amount of ways, including dumbing down your ability to customize your character (not very "infinite" if you ask me). That's not to say there aren't redeeming qualities. After all, the Lutes twins are immediately recognizable characters to me despite only appearing in this one game. The concept of another failed utopia isn't bad either, it's just poorly executed. Columbia, due to the lack of real meaningful time spent exploring individual districts of the city, ultimately makes it feels forgettable, and, as a consequence, so does the message its existence is trying to give. This game could've been something good and provided meaningful conversation on the complex topic of racism as its predecessors did with objectivism and collectivism. Instead we're left with an unremarkable experience that will forever collect dust on the shelves of consumers everywhere.
A masterpiece of storytelling, art and game design. Few others have managed to achieve such quality, even less did so with an original score as exceptional as BioShock Infinite's.

Lo tengo en PS3, PS4, Nintendo Switch, y me faltaba aquí en pc. Y por que no tengo XBOX, si no, también lo tendría ahí.
Mi saga favorita compartiendo podio con Dark Souls. Ken Levine, no solo creaste una saga de videojuegos. Creaste grandes recuerdos que me acompañaran siempre. Gracias <3.

Don't expect this game to be like bioshock 1 and 2. The only similarities it has with the first and second game is you can get powers that shoot various things out of your hand. There is 0 reason to scavenge every single corner of columbia looking for a way to survive because for 2/3 of the game you have a companion that literally summons health and ammo out of thin air for you. 

Even ignoring that it doesn't live up to the first 2 games, its still not that great. Shooting is standard, powers are kinda fun if a little clunky to use, you can only carry 2 weapons at once and none of them are memorable, weapon upgrades are boring, and story is ok. It suffers from a lack in enemy variety (the replacement for big daddy is this handyman guy that kinda sucks) and the game isnt very difficult until the last couple areas. The best thing it has going for it is that visually, it looks incredible, especially for the time it released. I would not recommend this as a bioshock game and as a standalone title its not terrible, but isnt good either.
meh!! Too big, too same, nothing new

booker,are you aforid of god?
No,I'm aforid of you.
booker,I miss you.
这是布克与伊丽莎白互相拯救的旅程。伊丽莎白是布克的救赎，布克是伊丽莎白的希望。谁又不希望一天有一个骑士来带自己逃离牢笼？伊丽莎白可以说是最好的队友，最灵动的队友。布克为了拯救伊丽莎白做出了选择，而伊丽莎白也如同布克一样为了拯救莎莉做出了自己的选择，这样的无愧于自己的内心，已经足够了。
晕3d的朋友注意，在进行游戏时将画质拉到最高能有效减轻症状。
不管怎么说，能够完整的体会这个游戏是一种幸运。（dlc指路，下载内容->海葬两部曲，时间位于无限本篇之后，第一部之前）
希望每位体验这个游戏的朋友都能有一个完美的体验。
Unique look and story very rare case of an ego-shooter RPG.
如果早知道不能带你去巴黎，我会永远看着你在那片沙滩上翩翩起舞。晚安，伊丽莎白。

13年的游戏，放在现在画面，人物建模与机制都已经稍微落后，但场景与远景依然能打，复古的场景与花园很美，给我带来优秀的沉浸感与体验感。喜欢复古蒸汽朋克的玩家不要错过。
游玩体验上不得不说一下伊丽莎白，简直是陪伴型NPC的天花板，有的关卡在战斗中会时不时的寻找一下她，并体验她带给你的喜怒哀乐，会被她的情绪感染。真的像一个有血有肉的人陪你走完全程。
最后听说这个游戏的工作室已经解散，很遗憾，多希望有朝一日能见到这个游戏的重制版，与次世代下的伊丽莎白再来一次冒险，并且这次有另外一个结局，一起去那该死的巴黎。
ey yanno it aint no bioshock one uh two but its pretty alright!
I need a DLC with only Elizabeth in it.

Насколько круто сделана основная игра, 2 сюжетных дополнения. От финала просто крышу сносит. А развязка дополнений замыкает круг. Всю игру кайфуешь от диалогов, от стрельбы, от поиска ништяков и атмосферы. Одно из самых прикольных решений , дать гг напарницу. В Элизабет вообще трудно не влюбиться, она мало того , что нарисована суперски, так она еще очень женственная и наивная. Вот играешь , получаешь удовольствие, выбиваешь достижения, а потом запускаешь длс с отстрелом волн и настолько сильно разочаровываешься, что п...ц. Такое чувство , что длс на откуп дали каким то тупым детишкам и статодрочерам. Типу предложившему и в этой части ввести богомерзкие волны - гори в аду мразь! Но игра одна из лучших в игровой индустрии , за все время. Так что обязательно пройти всем, кто еще не.
Great first person shooter for both gameplay and storyline

Bem diferente dos outros Bioshocks, porém ainda assim um jogão, e com um final que PQP, absurdo!!! Os gráficos desse jogo são inacreditáveis pra época, a trilha sonora espetacular e a gameplay é gostosinha, recomendo muito.
Fucking litty

This was a great game with a good story and fun FPS combat. It is a very big step up from the first two BioShock games in terms of game engine and graphics. I highly recommend playing at least the first BioShock game beforehand. The DLC is definitely worth it and connects to the story of the first game.
Ta guenísimo, cómpralo.
Buena historia y jugabilidad, supera por mucho a su anterior entrega pero no llega al mismo nivel que el primer BioShock, muy recomendado. 8/10

[h1] 艺术 [/h1]
总是听人吹生化奇兵：无限是第九艺术，玩了之后才发现大家都谦虚了，生化奇兵：无限就他妈是艺术品！

[h1] 遗憾 [/h1]
这么多年的游戏经历，早就让我对剧情体验有一定的耐受性了，但生化奇兵：无限还是最让我感到破防和遗憾的，遗憾在这么晚才开始一段艺术体验，更遗憾在没有带我的伊丽莎白去一趟巴黎

[h1] 伊丽莎白[/h1]
不说当年，就从现在再往后走十年，我说我的宝贝伊丽莎白是游戏史上最佳队友在座的各位没有意见吧

Meu Deus! Acabei de terminar a história e que jogo, meus amigos. Vale cada centavo pago! Uma das melhores narrativas em games com plost twist incrível no final. Os gráficos envelheceram muito bem, continua lindo demais. A trilha sonora e jogabilidade foi um dos pontos altos também. COMPREM! É incrível, é surreal, isso pra um game lançado pra geração xbox 360 e ps3. Um dos melhores jogos que já pude jogar!

"The writers were so preoccupied with whether or not they could, they didn’t stop to think if they should."

Let's get something straight, this isn't a BioShock game. It feels more like a spiritual successor with a hard call-back in it. That said, BioShock or not, this game is fantastic. BioShock 1 was an interesting title, it took the FPS and turned it into something new, created a unique experience. BioShock 2 built on that. It ironed out the wrinkles and improved on what worked, all while being bold enough to try something new. This gave us was what is in my opinion one of the most perfect examples of what a sequel should do. BioShock Infinite, then, possessing all that same potential and magic, says, no no, we're going back. We're going back to FPS proper, and we're still gonna push. But this time, we're gonna push forward. The result is a more traditional FPS game that still feels just as innovative and exciting as what came before it.
The story, while certainly well executed, I'll admit makes some rather... interesting, decisions at some points. But it's ultimately inconsequential, still providing a very engaging experience with an interesting premise.
